issue.title: Bug: Dock flickers on top of fullscreen window
issue.body:
Hi! I'm experiencing some flickering:

https://photos.app.goo.gl/pFcSkBp2fAXtKDL16

Only
- on the second monitor,
- when dock auto hide is enabled,
- when Chrome window is maximized
- and active.
- on OpenSUSE Tumbleweed, GNOME 3.38.3, Wayland, Dash to Dock v69.

It worked well with OpenSUSE Leap 15.2, GNOME 3.34

It works well if I log out and log in X instead of the default Wayland.

Thanks for the extension. I like it this way since Unity.

comment.body:
> https://extensions.gnome.org/extension/1873/disable-unredirect-fullscreen-windows/
> 
> after enable this extension, the problem fixed.

oh my god thank you this was driving me insane

issue.title: App Badge from Chromium ignored
issue.body:
According to issue [#1964] Dash to Dock now respects apps badge counter, if the setting 'Application-provided counter overrides the notifications counter' is set:

![image](https://github.com/micheleg/dash-to-dock/assets/43640404/2ca660f0-7de0-406d-9ac2-cc9b6decbebc)

We are writing a PWA that uses navigator.setAppBadge to set the badge counter. under macOS this successfully displays a badge next to App Icon, but under linux this is ignored (in both cases using Chromium as the browser running it). I am not sure if the error is in the chromium code, but as it works under Mac I would assume the bug is in how dash-to-dock reads the application-provided counter?

issue.title: Dash to Dock breaks in Gnome 45
issue.body:
## What happened
After I updated my system, Dash to Dock stopped working and I believe it's because I'm now running GNOME 45

I don't know if it's the same issue as this one... maybe it is
- https://github.com/micheleg/dash-to-dock/issues/2106

## Error Message
```console
The settings of extension dash-to-dock@micxgx.gmail.com had an error:
SyntaxError: export declarations may only appear at top level of a module

Stack trace:
@file:///usr/share/gnome-shell/extensions/dash-to-dock@micxgx.gmail.com/prefs.js:32:16
_init/GLib.MainLoop.prototype.runAsync/</<@resource:///org/gnome/gjs/modules/core/overrides/GLib.js:266:34
```


![image](https://github.com/micheleg/dash-to-dock/assets/10969700/cc6df6e3-1123-4395-b79c-73939c3eafe5)

## My System
> Please if there's any information I can provide let me know cus I'd love to help

Here's my `neofetch`
![image](https://github.com/micheleg/dash-to-dock/assets/10969700/defea126-67a4-4421-a89e-d81e24a30907)

comment.body:
Ok,  I've just installed the current git version and the bug disappeared!

![image](https://github.com/micheleg/dash-to-dock/assets/10969700/3f5388d6-3cd6-427c-aaee-428d0ecb03c4)

So I don't know what happened between `Dash to Dock` version 84 and 89 but it fixed the issue. Great! I'll close this issue then 🚀

issue.title: JS ERROR: TypeError: "ANIMATION_TIME" is read-only
issue.body:
After upgrading to gnome-shell 44 -> 45 and dash-to-dock 84 -> 89, clicking on the "Show Apps" button does nothing. 
I can't open Apps list.
The log shows errors:

```
JS ERROR: TypeError: "ANIMATION_TIME" is read-only
 _onShowAppsButtonToggled/<@file:///usr/share/gnome-shell/extensions/dash-to-dock@micxgx.gmail.com/docking.js:2587:21
  @resource:///org/gnome/shell/ui/init.js:21:20
```

comment.body:
> To fix it just run:

Thanks! 
Running gsettings fixed the issue

issue.title: JS ERROR: TypeError: "ANIMATION_TIME" is read-only
issue.body:
After upgrading to gnome-shell 44 -> 45 and dash-to-dock 84 -> 89, clicking on the "Show Apps" button does nothing. 
I can't open Apps list.
The log shows errors:

```
JS ERROR: TypeError: "ANIMATION_TIME" is read-only
 _onShowAppsButtonToggled/<@file:///usr/share/gnome-shell/extensions/dash-to-dock@micxgx.gmail.com/docking.js:2587:21
  @resource:///org/gnome/shell/ui/init.js:21:20
```

comment.body:
Same problem. Can confirm that the disabled animations setting was the problem.

Had to re-enable it through the Dash to Dock settings tho.

```
❯ gsettings set org.gnome.shell.extensions.dash-to-dock animate-show-apps true
No such schema “org.gnome.shell.extensions.dash-to-dock”
``

issue.title: JS ERROR: TypeError: "ANIMATION_TIME" is read-only
issue.body:
After upgrading to gnome-shell 44 -> 45 and dash-to-dock 84 -> 89, clicking on the "Show Apps" button does nothing. 
I can't open Apps list.
The log shows errors:

```
JS ERROR: TypeError: "ANIMATION_TIME" is read-only
 _onShowAppsButtonToggled/<@file:///usr/share/gnome-shell/extensions/dash-to-dock@micxgx.gmail.com/docking.js:2587:21
  @resource:///org/gnome/shell/ui/init.js:21:20
```

comment.body:
Yes it was made const in gnome-shell 45.beta apparently. But you'll only hit that error if you disabled animations. To fix it just run:
```
gsettings set org.gnome.shell.extensions.dash-to-dock animate-show-apps true
```

issue.title: JS ERROR: TypeError: this._prepareStartupAnimation() is undefined
issue.body:
Running Debian Experimental / GNOME 45
dash-to-dock version 89

Every time I log in, I get the following error message in the logs:
```
gnome-shell[2405]: JS ERROR: TypeError: this._prepareStartupAnimation() is undefined
                   _loadBackground/signalId</id<@resource:///org/gnome/shell/ui/layout.js:688:26
                   @resource:///org/gnome/shell/ui/init.js:21:20
```

No log message when the extension is disabled

issue.title: Gap between dock and maximized window
issue.body:
There is a small gap between dock and maximized window, that only appears with "Panel mode" Off.
Is that intended behavior? Or is there any way to remove it?
I'm using Ubuntu 23.10. Thank you.
 
![Screenshot from 2023-10-19 13-27-15](https://github.com/micheleg/dash-to-dock/assets/36964755/d3f1cb73-453e-4213-ae32-40599bfe1274)
![Screenshot from 2023-10-19 13-27-24](https://github.com/micheleg/dash-to-dock/assets/36964755/90114bfc-ac17-4689-b766-36a3c3b05741)

issue.title: Gap between dock and maximized window
issue.body:
There is a small gap between dock and maximized window, that only appears with "Panel mode" Off.
Is that intended behavior? Or is there any way to remove it?
I'm using Ubuntu 23.10. Thank you.
 
![Screenshot from 2023-10-19 13-27-15](https://github.com/micheleg/dash-to-dock/assets/36964755/d3f1cb73-453e-4213-ae32-40599bfe1274)
![Screenshot from 2023-10-19 13-27-24](https://github.com/micheleg/dash-to-dock/assets/36964755/90114bfc-ac17-4689-b766-36a3c3b05741)

comment.body:
This is expected because the floating panel isn't meant to touch any window. But you should be able to tweak it manually by editing
```
/usr/share/gnome-shell/extensions/ubuntu-dock@ubuntu.com/stylesheet.css
```

Also in future please report Ubuntu Dock bugs by running:
```
ubuntu-bug gnome-shell-extension-ubuntu-dock
```

issue.title: [Possible bug] Invisible layer
issue.body:
Sorry I don't have much knowledge with gnome shell.

Sometimes I can't click on things in the lower part of a window. Coincidentally this lower part has the same height as the dock (the dock is hidden), but it extends from end to end horizontally. 

This keeps until I restart the shell (alt + F2 then `r`).

comment.body:
I'm seeing the same

If I set "Dodge windows" to off then I can resize a window by clicking on the bottom border

If it's set to on and the dock is visible I am unable to click on the bottom border

issue.title: Drag and drop not working
issue.body:
Gnome Version 3.32.2, v66.
Drag and drop functionality is missing. Favorites can't be rearranged.

comment.body:
> Same problem here, using Fedora 38 and gnome 44 (the problem showed up when I installed V-Shell and Just Perfection extensions). Maybe there's a way to "clean" the settings?

Favourites in AppGrid extension also causing the same conflict, drag and drop won't work anymore. Dash to Dock maintainers could cooperate with other popular extension maintainers to avoid conflicts. Just Perfection extension maintainer starts issue to make extensions compatible with each other, but sadly seems like Dash to Dock maintainers have no time or interest to cooperate.

issue.title: Window picker/Activities Overview wrong margin
issue.body:
Hello I have been trying to fix this problem with no luck I have tested dash to dock for a long time, and believe that the latest version is great for my use case.

the only last issue that I have is the margin when activities overview is activated.

This is without dash-to-dock

![Screenshot from 2023-10-18 14-52-08](https://github.com/micheleg/dash-to-dock/assets/31135704/cbc2794b-0a46-4c5d-825a-67f6e1c60d1e)


And this is with it

![Screenshot from 2023-10-18 14-49-44](https://github.com/micheleg/dash-to-dock/assets/31135704/7cd5b13f-239c-4dd4-b496-d4b98da4dbc3)

I customize the css with `padding: 5px;` to get closer to the OG dock

issue.title: Dock disabled on start session after update to gnome 45
issue.body: to re-enable dock again, i going to extension and switch off  and on

comment.body:
Next time the problem happens please run:
```
journalctl -b0 /usr/bin/gnome-shell > journal.txt
```
and attach the resulting text file here.
